intro: Selinum ostruthium, commonly known as the greater celandine, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and yellow flowers. The plant has a rhizomatous root system that allows it to spread vegetatively. Its leaves are typically broad and lobed, while its flowers are small and clustered in umbels. Selinum ostruthium is often found in moist soils along riverbanks and in woodland areas.
